intro: Freziera boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian freziera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
